articles.title: Man City to follow Julian Alvarez deal with two more Argentina starlets as initial transfer talks held
articles.description: Man City could follow the transfer of young striker Julian Alvarez by signing two more starlets from Argentina, according to reports.
articles.content:
Julian Alvarez might not be the only young Argentine starlet to join Man City this year as they are reportedly scouting two Boca Juniors players.

articles.title: ‘Don’t Like People Yelling Shut Up to Me’: Holger Rune Vents Out His Frustration on Fans in Buenos Aires
articles.description: Next Gen ATP star Holger Rune took to his Instagram, posting a story about his tiff with fans in his first round defeat in Argentina Open.

articles.title: Tearful Juan Martin del Potro nears retirement, exits Argentina Open
articles.description: Argentinian tennis player Juan Martin del Potro lost in what appeared to be a farewell match in front of home fans at the Argentina Open tournament.
articles.content:
2009 U.S. Open champion Juan Martin del Potro lost on Tuesday in what appeared to be a farewell match in front of his home fans at the Argentina Open tournament.

articles.title: Tearful Juan Martin Del Potro Loses Comeback at Argentina Open
articles.description: Argentine great Juan Martin del Potro made a losing return to tennis after a two-and-a-half-year injury absence.
articles.content: Argentine great Juan Martin del Potro made a losing return to tennis after a two-and-a-half-year injury absence on Tuesday, beaten in straight sets by compatriot Federico Delbonis in the Argentina Open. In what was expected to be one of Del Potro’s f... [1653 chars]

articles.title: 'No to the IMF': thousands protest in Argentina against debt deal

articles.content:
Thousands of Argentines marched through the streets of Buenos Aires on Tuesday to protest against a likely deal with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to revamp more than $40 billion of debt the country cannot pay back.

articles.title: Brazil Plays Down British Flights To Falklands That Worry Argentina
articles.description: Brazil on Tuesday defended its decision to allow British military planes flying to the Falklands Islands to stop at Brazilian airports, landings that annoyed Argentina.
articles.content:
